nodes.description: 在复活节星期日，斯里兰卡发生了大规模的协调袭击。
nodes.support_text: On Easter Sunday, massive, coordinated attacks rocked Sri Lanka.

nodes.description: 三座教堂和三家豪华酒店在科伦坡、尼甘布和拜蒂克洛亚遭到近乎同时发生的爆炸袭击；后来，科伦坡的一座低成本旅馆和一栋住宅区也发生了两起爆炸。
nodes.support_text: Near-simultaneous explosions ripped through three churches and three luxury hotels across the cities of Colombo, Negombo, and Batticaloa; later, two further explosions hit a low-budget inn and a residential complex in Colombo.

nodes.description: 截至目前，死亡人数接近300人，另有约500人受伤。
nodes.support_text: To date, the death toll stands at nearly 300 people, with around 500 more reported injured.

nodes.description: 根据美联社的报道，教堂和酒店袭击是由七名自杀式炸弹袭击者共同执行的。
nodes.support_text: According to the AP, the church and hotel attacks were collectively executed by seven suicide bombers.

nodes.description: 虽然没有组织声称对袭击负责，但一名斯里兰卡官员指责了伊斯兰教激进组织国家Thuweeth Jama’ath。
nodes.support_text: No group has yet claimed responsibility, though a Sri Lankan official blamed the National Thowheeth Jama’ath, a radical Islamist organization, for the casualties.

nodes.description: 炸弹爆炸后，斯里兰卡当局封锁了主要社交媒体平台，以遏制虚假信息的传播。
nodes.support_text: After the bombs went off, authorities in the country blocked major social networks—a bid to stanch misinformation in a country where online falsehoods have been known to exacerbate intercommunal tensions.
Facebook, WhatsApp, and Instagram went dark; so did YouTube, Snapchat, and Viber.

nodes.description: 社交媒体平台的关闭在外国报道中备受关注，因为一些媒体指出，这些平台不再被视为重要的“应急响应机构”。
nodes.support_text: The shutdown featured prominently in foreign reporting on the attacks: as several outlets pointed out, platforms that were seen, a few years ago, as important “emergency response institutions” are no longer trusted with that function.

nodes.description: 全球之声的执行董事Ivan Sigal告诉《纽约时报》，斯里兰卡的断网是对这些平台的“毁灭性控诉”。
nodes.support_text: Ivan Sigal, executive director of Global Voices, told The New York Times that the Sri Lanka blackout was a “damning indictment” of the platforms;

nodes.description: 其他观察者认为，国家支持的互联网关闭设定了一个危险的先例。
nodes.support_text: Other observers, however, maintain that state-backed internet shutdowns set a dangerous precedent.

nodes.description: 社交媒体封锁创造信息真空，容易被其他势力利用，加剧恐惧和恐慌。
nodes.support_text: Alp Toker, executive director of NetBlocks, added, to the AP: “When social media is shut down, it creates a vacuum of information that’s readily exploited by other parties. It can add to the sense of fear and can cause panic.”

nodes.description: Sanjana Hattotuwa指出，社交媒体封锁虽然有助于控制谣言的传播，但也妨碍了记者的努力。
nodes.support_text: Sanjana Hattotuwa told The Washington Post that “while a ban on social media helps to contain the spread of rumors, it also hampers efforts by journalists to push back on them.”

nodes.description: 主要平台在处理垃圾信息方面的失败，特别是在快节奏的新闻事件中。
nodes.support_text: It is undeniable that major platforms have failed to get to grips with junk information, particularly during fast-moving news events.

nodes.description: 不应忽视国家自上而下的审查风险。
nodes.support_text: Nonetheless, we shouldn’t let our (justified) anger at Facebook et al blind us to the risks of top-down censorship in countries.
